legacy.full_text: Voters strongly support abortion rights, for example ‚Äî and if Republicans were to revert to their 2012 positions of opposing marriage equality and wanting to kick gay soldiers out of the military they‚Äôd get crushed.

legacy.description: Slow Boring, cohosting https://t.co/wxUj3JFSFf, Bloomberg columnist
legacy.name: Matthew Yglesias

legacy.full_text: Conversely, while there is tremendous support for lots of individual items on the progressive economic agenda nobody wants to pay higher taxes which puts pretty serious limits on what you can actually do here. https://t.co/CRyKD60VK2

legacy.description: Slow Boring, cohosting https://t.co/wxUj3JFSFf, Bloomberg columnist
legacy.name: Matthew Yglesias

legacy.full_text:
The main thing I would say is that voters tend to be pretty *selfish* in their orientation ‚Äî they want policy ideas that they believe will benefit them, personally. 

This is out of step with the progressive discourse that claims strict priority for the most marginal.

legacy.description: Slow Boring, cohosting https://t.co/wxUj3JFSFf, Bloomberg columnist
legacy.name: Matthew Yglesias

legacy.full_text:
But it‚Äôs also out of step with abstract conservative/libertarian ideas about free markets and capitalism. 

If you can offer voters something better than a market outcome, they want that.

legacy.description: Greek, German and English translator. First German-to-English translator of ‚ÄúPractical Idealism - The Kalergi Plan‚Äù by Count Coudenhove-Kalergi.
legacy.name: Dimitra

legacy.full_text: Mass immigration to the West is a concept developed by R.N. Coudenhove-Kalergi in his 1925 book, "Practical Idealism." The original German version, "Praktischer Idealismus," is still in circulation today. I have translated one such copy into English.
